title: Tom Caluwé
text:
Tom Caluwé (born 11 April 1978) is a Belgian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager, executive, and former player. He currently serves as the sporting director of <a href="KV%20Mechelen">KV Mechelen</a>.
Club career.
Caluwé is a midfielder who was born in <a href="Rumst">Rumst</a> and made his debut in professional football, being part of the <a href="KV%20Mechelen">KV Mechelen</a> squad in the 1996–97 season. He also played for <a href="Willem%20II%20Tilburg">Willem II Tilburg</a> and <a href="FC%20Utrecht">FC Utrecht</a> in the Dutch <a href="Eredivisie">Eredivisie</a> before joining <a href="Al-Wakrah">Al-Wakrah</a>.
International career.
Caluwé represented <a href="Belgium%20national%20football%20team">Belgium</a> in the <a href="1997%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">1997 FIFA World Youth Championship</a> and he has one A-cap in which he scored.
Managerial career.
KV Mechelen.
In the summer 2014, Caluwé returned to <a href="KV%20Mechelen">KV Mechelen</a> as an assistant coach. In September 2016, Caluwé was appointed interim head coach, where he was in charge for one game, which he won 2-0 against <a href="Sint-Truidense%20V.V.">Sint-Truidense</a>. In October 2017, he was appointed interim head coach once again, this time for two games, which he both lost.
In May 2018, he was promoted to Mechelen's technical sporting department, as an assistant to the clubs sporting director, Stefaan Vanroy. In the summer 2019, he was appointed sporting director of the club.
